name: Node JS web developer
description:
Our Company

We are a new startup business that is looking to create a new online marketplace that never existed before.

The Role

We are looking for a passionate, experienced NodeJS web developer to join our team to build an eCommerce online marketplace website. This position is for 6 months with option to extend to a permanent full-time position.

You will be joining our main developer to build the site based on existing HTML design.

You must have 2+ years of experience NodeJS, Javascript, React, either through projects, or freelancing work that you’ve done, or through past work experience.

You must have great passion for coding, web development, a team player with excellent communication skills.

You will need to demonstrate your experience and skills by showcasing your portfolio of previous sites that you have built, explaining and showing what tools you used to build the sites..

You will contribute to building both front and back end of the site, including creating SQL databases.

It is an advantage if you are familiar with Amazon AWS hosting, server-less application, and have experience with integrating websites with Stripe payment gateway.

Only candidates who are Australian permanent resident or citizen will be considered.

The site

Is an online marketplace for users to hire items from each other. Users can sign up for an account and log in; Search, find, read reviews, check other user profile, send messages to other users, and hire listed item from another user. The user can list multiple items for hire (available on which day and from the time it is available on each day). User can hire the listed item and select the days and time that he wants to hire. When the item is hired, our platform will process payment through Stripe payment gateway.

Part-time hours: 20-30 per week

Expected Start Date: 12/10/2020

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Permanent

Salary: $30.00 – $35.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Node JS web developer: 2 years (Preferred)
  • javascript: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Required)

Work Remotely:

  • No

name: Fullstack Javascript Developer | React/Node.js
description:
About us:

Canibuild (www.canibuild.com) helps the residential construction industry automate and improve how construction is sold, designed, and approved.
Work alongside a mix of embedded construction professionals and leading software developers to research and develop cutting edge applications.
Today, we are a growing SaaS start-up with a rapid subscriber user base from around the world including Australia, NZ, Canada, and the United States.

The Position:

We require a experienced Full-stack Developer to join a dynamic team of passionate programmers working on world-first technology. In this position, you will have the opportunity to develop innovative applications using various cutting-edge technologies and following Agile practices.
You'll be part of an agile and effective team as you build the product and integrate it into a disruptive SaaS application.

What technical skills will you need to succeed in this role?

  • 2+ years of Full Stack Development experience, using ReactJS/Redux/Hooks and Node.js/Express/Typescript
  • Solid experience with JavaScript, ES6, HTML5, CSS3 and responsive application design
  • Cross-browser, cross-platform, cross-device compatibility issues and ways to work around them
  • Rapidly prototype web applications to showcase new concepts and ideas
  • Suggests new technologies and approaches
  • Estimate the duration and level of effort of development tasks
  • Experience working with Agile methodologies
  • Understand modern development practices (CI/CD, Cloud, etc.)
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines, and work independently and within a team, with clear reporting and focused on results

Desirable Experience:

Interactive map libraries such as Leaflet.js, GIS data handling (GeoJSON, shapefiles, etc.) and AWS

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $100,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • Javascript: 3 years (Preferred)
  • Full Stack: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Required)

name: Fullstack Javascript Developer | React/Node.js
description:

Bookipi (Bookipi.com) is a leading business software company based in Sydney. Our apps are used by over 780,000 businesses across 179 countries and growing everyday.
We have an amazing team and aim to be the top in each category we compete in. Technical ability and culture fit are key across the team. We're excited to see what you've got.

ReactJS or React Native
Javascript
Node.JS
MongoDB

About you

  • The willingness to learn and adapt your methodologies, and the ability to share your learnings with the team.
  • A team player who can communicate appropriately for the role.

Do you fit?

We're seeking a suitably qualified and experienced full stack developer desired for immediate start.

You will work in a team responsible for delivering top-of-class software and testing services.

This is an opportunity to bring your skills and experience to an environment where you will make a difference. You are encouraged to take an innovative and proactive approach to your work with the support of a great team.

Expected Start Date: 12/10/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Experience:

Work Eligibility:

name: Senior Node.JS Developer Brisbane | Permanent - Full time
description:
We're exclusively hiring for Coviu, a fast growth and well-funded start-up who provide a global telehealth platform, allowing doctors to run their practices whilst consulting seamlessly and securely with patients online. They have been steadily growing, however the Covid 19 outbreak has seen them grow rapidly from hundreds of customers per week signing up, to now thousands. At the current customer growth rate, they expect to have 50,000 customers using their product in the coming weeks.

We are looking for a superstar who can cope with the significant high demands of this rapidly growing business and help them approach best practices and implement solutions fast to help scale their platform.

Coviu was first created within the Australian research organisation CSIRO as part of research into telehealth delivery platforms. Working closely with clinicians, they found that existing consumer video calling software and corporate video conferencing applications were not appropriate for healthcare services. Not only did they not satisfy the stringent security and privacy requirements of healthcare businesses, but they missed important business functions such as collecting payments, making appointment bookings, and gathering patient consent.

The Tech:

As a full stack developer, you'll be working across the front-end and back-end software stack, with a focus on back-end.

The back-end is Node.js primarily, with some servers using Scala and Haskell. They follow a micro services architecture since the backend services that power video consultations scale in a diverse manner. Everything is built around APIs. The local development environment is spun up using Docker images to allow you full control. They follow a continuous integration and continuous delivery approach with a vast automated test suite and an automated deployment pipeline into AWS. You'll be working across most of the Coviu platform components, including their WebRTC based video conferencing solution, third party integrations, and their internal and external applications.

Coviu's client facing web application is built with a particular focus on a top notch user experience. Built on the React and Mercury frameworks, they follow modern responsive design principles. Mobile apps are build using react-native.

You'll also be helping to build Coviu's engineering culture by identifying and communicating best practices, and participating in code reviews.

What we're looking for:

As Coviu's stack is heavily based on Javascript technologies, you will have:

  • Experience as a full stack engineer delivering production ready systems using modern Javascript
  • A deep understanding of software engineering fundamentals
  • Proven debugging and troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute as part of a team
  • A love of clean, maintainable code
  • Be able to build simple, elegant solutions that strike the balance between perfection and shipping things quickly.

They are looking for engineers who love to learn and are keen to get stuck in, while taking

responsibility for delivering a quality product.

This opportunity is an excellent opportunity for an outstanding Senior Developer/Lead developer to join one of Australia's leading telehealth platforms, and apply your skills to make a real difference. You will be making a huge contribution and helping the greater community by making these consults more accessible.

You will contribute to the growth and development of this business. Please contact Bharti on 07 3003 7643 quoting reference number #202466 for more information, or click the link to apply!

name: .Net /Node.Js Lead
description:
.Net/Node.js Development Lead

  • Exciting new greenfield project in a newly created lead role
  • Heavily funded global fintech company with remote and onshore teams
  • Great benefits and flexibility located in the Sydney CBD

The opportunity:

In this exciting and upbeat opportunity, we are calling for a driven, Senior .Net developer to step into the Lead role on a very exciting product. The platform and accompanying mobile application are currently on its second year and is a Greenfields project looking to release in several months.

You are an experienced leader with strong practice throughout the SDLC, someone who has been deep in the trenches building stable and consistent applications. With a desire to consistently adhere to Best practices and a burning passion for new technology and cloud-native applications, you will strive for excellence in every aspect of this build. You will be required to provide extensive experience with the architectural implementation input to the developers as well as be a link between the business analyst team to transfer domain knowledge and requirements effectively into development.

Responsibilities and Values that will help:

  • A strong and transparent communicator who can adapt to working and coordinating teams worldwide
  • Proactive approach with an inquisitive mindset.
  • Ability to prioritize and leverage technologies and platforms to understand which components work better
  • Managing releases and day to day requirements to support all teams in your vertical
  • Continuously improving and maintaining the CI/CD pipeline
  • Working with different product teams to drive and deliver continuous quality control and improvements

Key Skills

  • Deep understanding and architectural knowledge working with a Microsoft stack.
  • Ability to effectively analyze workflow patterns and distribute work efficiently as the Node.JS serverless solutions and .Net development team.
  • Experience working with disbursed quality testing teams, having a solid understanding of best practices and tooling, both automation and manual functional Testing.
  • Proven experience designing, building and managing applications on Azure and AWS.
  • Experience working with Databases that are Relation or Non-relational
  • SQL Server experience or any other relevant technologies as well as depth of experience working with AWS.
  • Design and build API's as well as automating and maintaining documentation to support them.

If you are interested in a new upbeat opportunity where you will oversee some of the biggest changes and greatest improvements come to life, then Apply Now through the direct link above as applications will be shortlisted immediately

name: Front End Technical Lead / JS Engineer - React & Node
description:
• Central CBD Location & Excellent Salary
  • Exciting Career Opportunity
  • Highly Progressive Technical Environment

An Exciting & Innovative FinTech SaaS Business Are Seeking A Technical Lead To Spearhead Their Front End Platforms across their varied product stack. Extensive knowledge across Javascript frameworks are key. Ideally - React.JS / Redux, but knowledge across Angular, Vue or Ember is well regarded.

This opportunity is centered around large re-platforming program of work and building out the key architecture and their front end frameworks. These cutting edge platforms will allow for much improved engagements with customers. This is a highly strategic role, with the successful person being a front end technologist, with a flair for delivery and building high quality frameworks and components.

As Tech Lead you will have responsibility for the platform, product road-map, architectural design, and the development environment. You’ll bring a blend of leadership and strategic skills needed to be applied in a technical context. You will be hands-on in this role, while coordinating project teams across and being involved in the overall strategy for the front end standards and components.

This is an exciting role and offers the right person a very interesting space to carve out an exciting career. The right person to fill this role, will really help take this business to the next level.

Key Skills Experience:

  • Highly experienced in Javascript, ES6+ development and building web applications
  • Have worked extensively with APIs and Micro Services Architectures. Plus knowledge around serverless architecture, design, building, testing, and deployment automation.
  • A solid grounding in Javascript frameworks. Ideally React.js and Redux. Other frameworks are well regarded - Angular / Ember
  • Have lead technical teams on medium to large sized project
  • Expert level CSS3 & HTML5
  • Exposure to GraphQL is very advantageous
  • Any Agile knowledge is well regarded
  • Strong skills in Linux, MongoDB or CouchDB advantageous
  • Very strong communication skills - Written and oral

Nice to Have:

  • Have been involved in digital transformation transitions
  • Have experience working in SaaS Fintechs or Wealth Management environments

To find out more about this opportunity; please email: ds@limelightpeople.com.au or call: 02 8458 2626
